page.title: 04Ecology - Climate.
page.content: The climate of the area can best be described as cool and moist. The average annual rainfall at a small reservoir 3km. north of Windermere is approx. 1650mm. per annum but, in practice, such figures have little meaning. The 'summer' of 1985 is turning out to be one of the worst on record. Temperatures and sunshine hours are well below average while the number of days with rain is well above. This contrasts with 1984 which had one of the worst droughts on record. Rain fell on only five days between late April and the end of August and there were frequent spells of several days with unbroken sunshine. Winters can vary similarly. The last one had only 7 days when snow fell and was not noted for cold spells. Weather is much less severe in winter than 'offcomers' imagine.
